CONJUGATES: arrows (n. pl.) | arrows (v. 3rd P. sing.) | arrowing (v. pres. part.) | arrowed (v. past/p.p.)
ETYMOLOGY: From Old English earwe, from Old Norse ǫrv, possibly related to Latin arcus (bow).

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A thin, straight shaft, typically pointed and usually feathered at the back, shot from a bow.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一种细而直的杆状物，通常带有尖头和羽毛，由弓发射。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The archer notched the arrow and pulled back the string.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 弓箭手将箭搭在弦上，拉开了弓。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A sign or graphic symbol, usually a straight line with a V-shaped end, used to indicate direction, position, or flow.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一种符号或图形，通常为一端带有V形尖端的直线，用于指示方向、位置或流程。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Click the green arrow to start the download.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 点击绿色箭头开始下载。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To move swiftly and directly, like an arrow shot from a bow.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 快速、直接地移动，如离弦之箭。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The speedboat arrowed toward the distant island.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 快艇像箭一样射向远方的岛屿。
